intro: Nauclea glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular nauclea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, often glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Nauclea glandulosa is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to arid environments.
